message_1: Let f(z) = z^3 - 2z^2 + 6z - 10. Determine if f(z) is an analytic function in the complex plane, and if it is, find its derivative at z = i.
message_2:
f(z) is a polynomial function, and all polynomial functions are analytic in the complex plane. Therefore, f(z) is an analytic function.

To find the derivative of f(z), we differentiate each term with respect to z:

f'(z) = d/dz (z^3) - d/dz (2z^2) + d/dz (6z) - d/dz (10)

f'(z) = 3z^2 - 4z + 6

Now, we find the derivative at z = i:

f'(i) = 3(i)^2 - 4(i) + 6

f'(i) = 3(-1) - 4i + 6

f'(i) = -3 - 4i + 6

f'(i) = 3 - 4i

So, the derivative of f(z) at z = i is f'(i) = 3 - 4i.
